Class ControllerMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ControllerMain

  • public class ControllerMain
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0
    Description: controller class that controls the navigation, addition, editing, saving, and organization of the Flash Card data
    Author:
    Trinh Nguyen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ModelFlashCardAllDecks _allDecks
      Stores all the flash card decks used in the program.
      private java.awt.Color _chosenColor
      Holds the color that all new cards will be created by if _colorLock is true.
      private boolean _colorLock
      Returns true if the user wants all new cards created to have the same color.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> _colorsTable
      Stored colors that enables new cards to obtain a color from.
      private ModelFlashCard _currentCard
      Stores the data of the current card being displayed.
      private boolean _editFront
      Used by the editing JDialog window to determine when to show text for front or back of _currentCard.
      private java.io.File _file
      Stores the file being opened or saved into.
      private boolean _front
      Returns true if the card is currently showing data of the front of the card.
      private boolean _isChanged
      Returns true if the user made some changes to the deck.
      private ViewMainScreenJPanel _mainScreenJPanel
      The main GUI that controls all visual components.
      private boolean _newFile
      Returns true if the deck is currently a new deck and was not loaded from a file.
      private boolean _popUpMessages
      Returns true if there is a message or window currently opened.
      private java.lang.String _tempOldBackText
      Holds old card back text data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.
      private java.awt.Color _tempOldColor
      Holds old card color data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.
      private java.lang.String _tempOldFrontText
      Holds old card front text data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.
      private boolean _viewingMainDeck
      Returns true if the user is currently viewing the main deck and not the memorized deck.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ControllerMain(javax.swing.JFrame mainJFrame)
      Constructor, sets all attributes to default values.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addColorsToColorTable()
      Adds various colors to the _colorsTable
      void addNewCardMainScreen()
      Adds a new card and sets the appropriate data.
      void cancelButton()
      Used by editing JDialog window when Cancel button is pushed.
      void cancelEditChanges()
      Used by FlashCardJDialog when the user hits the cancel button.
      void confirmExit()
      Make sure the use wants to save before exiting the program.
      private java.lang.String convertFromCardString(java.lang.String text)
      FlashCard strings are stored with html code, this method converts it from html to regular text.
      void delete()
      Used by JDialog edit window.
      void deleteFlashCard()
      Permanently removes the card from the main deck and the complete deck.
      static void DoAppleQuit(ControllerMain mainController)
      This method is ran whenever the user closes the program under OSX.
      void enqueueBackToCurrent()
      Used to enqueue the current card until it is back to the current card being displayed.
      void enqueueBackToFirst()
      Used to make the current card enqueue until it is the next in line.
      void enqueueBackToNext()
      Used to make the current card enqueue until it is the next next one in line.
      void flashCardPanelClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Called when the user left or right clicks on the currently displaying Flash Card JPanel.
      void flip()
      Flips the card.
      ModelFlashCardAllDecks getAllDecks()
      Getter method that allows other class to access the current deck.
      ModelFlashCard getCard()
      Getter method used by other methods and class to give access to the current card being shown to the user.
      java.awt.Color getColor(int cardCounter)
      Obtains a color from one of the colors stored in _colorsTable, uses modulus operator to obtain the color in order.
      java.io.File getFile()
      Getter method for currently loaded file.
      boolean getIsChanged()
      Getter method that returns true if the deck has been modified, else returns false.
      boolean getIsViewingMainDeck()
      Used by other classes and method to determine if the user is on the main deck.
      ViewMainScreenJPanel getMainScreen()
      Getter method that is used by TrinhFlashCardQueue to load in the Main Screen into the JFrame
      Complexity: O(1).
      void moveCurrentCardToOrFromMain()
      Used to move cards into Memorized pile or out of it
      Complexity: O(N) since nextCard() is O(N).
      void newCardEditCard()
      Used by JDialog window to quickly make changes to a card and then add a new card.
      void newDeck()
      Makes a new deck, ask for confirmation if changes were made.
      void newDeck(ModelFlashCardAllDecks newDeck)
      Used by fileOpener to set the current deck to the one chosen.
      void nextButtonEditJDialog()
      Used by editing JDialog window to change the function of the ViewMainScreenJPanel.getBtnNext() button.
      void nextCard()
      Used by controller to dequeue the deck and display that card.
      void open()
      Actual open method used by openDeck() and other methods.
      void openDeck()
      Opens the file that has deck data.
      void popUpEditJDialog()
      Makes the editing JDialog visible with correct data based on the deck being worked on.
      void previousCard()
      Used by controller to dequeue the deck and display that card.
      void quickAddNewCard()
      Used by EditCardJDialog to create new cards and update the FlashCardJPanel to that of the new card.
      void refreshButtonsAndCounters()
      Refreshes the buttons to enable or disable based on what the user is allowed to do.
      void resetDeck()
      Empties the Memorized Deck and Main Deck and recopies all cards from the Complete Deck.
      void resetEditCardWindow()
      Used by outside classes to update the colors and text on the JDialog before making it visible.
      void restore()
      Dequeue all the cards in memorized deck and move them over to the main deck.
      void save()
      Main core saving method, called when there is an active file to save to.
      void saveAsDeck()
      Ask the user for the location of where they want to save.
      void saveDeck()
      Save or Save As the current deck.

      Used by ViewEditCardColorButton to only change color but not JTextPane text.

      Setter method.
      void setFrameTitleUnsaved()
      Adds a "*" to the title if changes were made and not saved.
      void setIsChanged(boolean isChanged)
      Setter method used by other methods and class to determine if changes were made.
      void setNewDecks(ModelFlashCardAllDecks allDecks)
      Sets the current deck to the deck specified.
      void setSameColorCheckBox(boolean select)
      If the state of the checkBox is checked, then makes all new card have the same color.
      private void setTextPane(java.lang.String text)
      Used to write out the string on the text pane if there are data or no data on the FlashCard currently being read.
      private void setTextPaneBackground()
      Sets the background color of the textpane.
      void switchToMainDeck()
      Called every time the user clicks on the main deck pile.
      void switchToMemorized()
      Called every time the user clicks on the Memorized Deck pile.
      java.awt.Color unlockColor()
      Used to restore color to what the card color would be if it was not locked.
      void updateCard()
      Used by other classes to update the card in the main deck with new changes.

    • Field Detail

      • _allDecks

        private ModelFlashCardAllDecks _allDecks
        Stores all the flash card decks used in the program. This is what gets saved and loaded from file.

      • _currentCard

        private ModelFlashCard _currentCard
        Stores the data of the current card being displayed.

      • _mainScreenJPanel

        private ViewMainScreenJPanel _mainScreenJPanel
        The main GUI that controls all visual components.

      • _tempOldFrontText

        private java.lang.String _tempOldFrontText
        Holds old card front text data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.

      • _tempOldBackText

        private java.lang.String _tempOldBackText
        Holds old card back text data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.

      • _tempOldColor

        private java.awt.Color _tempOldColor
        Holds old card color data, reverts to this if cancel button is pushed during editing.

      • _chosenColor

        private java.awt.Color _chosenColor
        Holds the color that all new cards will be created by if _colorLock is true.

      • _file

        private java.io.File _file
        Stores the file being opened or saved into.

      • _colorsTable

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color> _colorsTable
        Stored colors that enables new cards to obtain a color from.

      • _front

        private boolean _front
        Returns true if the card is currently showing data of the front of the card.

      • _viewingMainDeck

        private boolean _viewingMainDeck
        Returns true if the user is currently viewing the main deck and not the memorized deck.

      • _isChanged

        private boolean _isChanged
        Returns true if the user made some changes to the deck. Used by different methods to. confirm to the user if they want to save.

      • _newFile

        private boolean _newFile
        Returns true if the deck is currently a new deck and was not loaded from a file.

      • _colorLock

        private boolean _colorLock
        Returns true if the user wants all new cards created to have the same color.

      • _editFront

        private boolean _editFront
        Used by the editing JDialog window to determine when to show text for front or back of _currentCard.

      • _popUpMessages

        private boolean _popUpMessages
        Returns true if there is a message or window currently opened. Used to disable hotkeys.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControllerMain

        public ControllerMain(javax.swing.JFrame mainJFrame)
        Constructor, sets all attributes to default values. Creates blank default decks for storing data and the GUI to display the information.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        mainJFrame - Reference to the main JFrame that will be storing all GUI components

    • Method Detail

      • nextCard

        public void nextCard()
        Used by controller to dequeue the deck and display that card.
        Complexity: O(N). The enqueue and dequeue itself is O(1) but repainting the deck icon to visually represent the changes is O(1).

      • previousCard

        public void previousCard()
        Used by controller to dequeue the deck and display that card.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • updateCard

        public void updateCard()
        Used by other classes to update the card in the main deck with new changes.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • resetDeck

        public void resetDeck()
        Empties the Memorized Deck and Main Deck and recopies all cards from the Complete Deck. So that the cards appear in the the order that the they were created.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • cancelEditChanges

        public void cancelEditChanges()
        Used by FlashCardJDialog when the user hits the cancel button. This restores the data as it was before Any changes was made.
        Complexity: O(N). enqueueBackToCurrent() is O(N). enqueueBackToCurrent() is required because text and color changes while the Edit Card JDialog window is opened need to be re-rendered in the ViewDeckIconJPanel. When cancelEditChanges() is performed, the changes need to be reverted.

      • getCard

        public ModelFlashCard getCard()
        Getter method used by other methods and class to give access to the current card being shown to the user.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _currentCard

      • deleteFlashCard

        public void deleteFlashCard()
        Permanently removes the card from the main deck and the complete deck.
        Complexity: O(N). Deleting a card from the complete deck requires searching through the deck, deleting, and shifting.

      • popUpEditJDialog

        public void popUpEditJDialog()
        Makes the editing JDialog visible with correct data based on the deck being worked on.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Flips the card.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • setColorLock

        public void setColorLock(boolean isColorLock)
        Setter method. Used by other methods to tell the program if new cards will have the same color.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        isColorLock - Sets true if the "same color for new card" check box is checked, else set false.

      • enqueueBackToCurrent

        public void enqueueBackToCurrent()
        Used to enqueue the current card until it is back to the current card being displayed. This is required for saving changes.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • enqueueBackToNext

        public void enqueueBackToNext()
        Used to make the current card enqueue until it is the next next one in line.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • enqueueBackToFirst

        public void enqueueBackToFirst()
        Used to make the current card enqueue until it is the next in line.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • newDeck

        public void newDeck(ModelFlashCardAllDecks newDeck)
        Used by fileOpener to set the current deck to the one chosen. Once deck is loaded, nextCard() is automatically called.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        newDeck - Reference to the file that contains the deck the user wants to load.

      • unlockColor

        public java.awt.Color unlockColor()
        Used to restore color to what the card color would be if it was not locked.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        getColor(int). A color from HelperCardColors based on the index of the main deck.

      • quickAddNewCard

        public void quickAddNewCard()
        Used by EditCardJDialog to create new cards and update the FlashCardJPanel to that of the new card.
        Complexity: O(N). Since addNewCardMainScreen() is O(N).

      • setIsChanged

        public void setIsChanged(boolean isChanged)
        Setter method used by other methods and class to determine if changes were made.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        isChanged - If the current deck has been changed, set isChanged = true, else set isChanged = false.

      • getIsChanged

        public boolean getIsChanged()
        Getter method that returns true if the deck has been modified, else returns false.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _isChanged

      • addNewCardMainScreen

        public void addNewCardMainScreen()
        Adds a new card and sets the appropriate data.
        Complexity: O(N). The adding of the card itself is O(1) but nextCard() is O(N).

      • setFrameTitleUnsaved

        public void setFrameTitleUnsaved()
        Adds a "*" to the title if changes were made and not saved.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Dequeue all the cards in memorized deck and move them over to the main deck.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • switchToMemorized

        public void switchToMemorized()
        Called every time the user clicks on the Memorized Deck pile.
        Complexity: O(N) since nextCard() is O(N).

      • switchToMainDeck

        public void switchToMainDeck()
        Called every time the user clicks on the main deck pile.
        Complexity: O(N) since nextCard() is O(N).

      • moveCurrentCardToOrFromMain

        public void moveCurrentCardToOrFromMain()
        Used to move cards into Memorized pile or out of it
        Complexity: O(N) since nextCard() is O(N).

      • refreshButtonsAndCounters

        public void refreshButtonsAndCounters()
        Refreshes the buttons to enable or disable based on what the user is allowed to do. Updates different components to represent the Flash Card Deck data.
        Complexity: O(N) because ViewDeckIconJPanel.updateDeckIcon(int) is O(N).

      • getIsViewingMainDeck

        public boolean getIsViewingMainDeck()
        Used by other classes and method to determine if the user is on the main deck. True if the user is currently viewing the main deck, else returns False (user is viewing memorized deck).
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _viewingMainDeck

      • setNewDecks

        public void setNewDecks(ModelFlashCardAllDecks allDecks)
        Sets the current deck to the deck specified. If no deck (allDecks is null) is specified, then a new deck is made.
        Complexity: O(1) if a new deck is made. O(N) if loading from a deck file.
        Parameters:
        allDecks - Reference to the deck loaded by the File, if allDecks is null, a new deck is created instead.

      • newDeck

        public void newDeck()
        Makes a new deck, ask for confirmation if changes were made.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • openDeck

        public void openDeck()
        Opens the file that has deck data.
        Complexity: O(N) since open() is O(N).

      • open

        public void open()
        Actual open method used by openDeck() and other methods.
        Complexity: O(N) sine nextCard() is O(N).

      • saveDeck

        public void saveDeck()
        Save or Save As the current deck.
        Complexity: O(N) since save() is O(N).

      • save

        public void save()
        Main core saving method, called when there is an active file to save to.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • saveAsDeck

        public void saveAsDeck()
        Ask the user for the location of where they want to save.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • confirmExit

        public void confirmExit()
        Make sure the use wants to save before exiting the program.
        Complexity: O(N) since saveDeck() is O(N).

      • flashCardPanelClicked

        public void flashCardPanelClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Called when the user left or right clicks on the currently displaying Flash Card JPanel.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        e - If 'e' is a right mouse click, then popUpEditJDialog() is called, else (left mouse click) flip() is called

      • resetEditCardWindow

        public void resetEditCardWindow()
        Used by outside classes to update the colors and text on the JDialog before making it visible.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • setTextPane

        private void setTextPane(java.lang.String text)
        Used to write out the string on the text pane if there are data or no data on the FlashCard currently being read.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        text - The string of what the TextPane of the ViewMainScreenJPanel.getEditCardJDialog() will show.

      • convertFromCardString

        private java.lang.String convertFromCardString(java.lang.String text)
        FlashCard strings are stored with html code, this method converts it from html to regular text.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        text - The string stored in the Flash Card data.
        Returns:
        The converted regular text as a String.

      • setTextPaneBackground

        private void setTextPaneBackground()
        Sets the background color of the textpane.
        Complexity: O(1).

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Used by ViewEditCardColorButton to only change color but not JTextPane text.
        Complexity: O(N) since enqueueBackToCurrent() is O(N).
        Parameters:
        color - The current color that the user selected

      • cancelButton

        public void cancelButton()
        Used by editing JDialog window when Cancel button is pushed. Revert changes done during editing.
        Complexity: O(N) since cancelEditChanges() is O(N).

      • nextButtonEditJDialog

        public void nextButtonEditJDialog()
        Used by editing JDialog window to change the function of the ViewMainScreenJPanel.getBtnNext() button.
        Complexity: O(N) since enqueueBackToCurrent() is O(N).

      • newCardEditCard

        public void newCardEditCard()
        Used by JDialog window to quickly make changes to a card and then add a new card.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • setSameColorCheckBox

        public void setSameColorCheckBox(boolean select)
        If the state of the checkBox is checked, then makes all new card have the same color.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        select - If select is true, check box is checked, sets colorLock true, saves the color the user selected to the _chosenColor. Else, sets colorLock to false, restore to the color that is next on the HelperCardColors

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Used by JDialog edit window. When the delete button is pushed, confirms to the user if they want to delete the current card.
        Complexity: O(N) since ModelFlashCardDeck.deleteCard(int) from complete deck is O(N).

      • getAllDecks

        public ModelFlashCardAllDecks getAllDecks()
        Getter method that allows other class to access the current deck.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _allDecks

      • getMainScreen

        public ViewMainScreenJPanel getMainScreen()
        Getter method that is used by TrinhFlashCardQueue to load in the Main Screen into the JFrame
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        Returns _mainScreenJPanel

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Getter method for currently loaded file.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _file

      • DoAppleQuit

        public static void DoAppleQuit(ControllerMain mainController)
        This method is ran whenever the user closes the program under OSX.
        Parameters:
        mainController - Reference to the main controller.

      • addColorsToColorTable

        public void addColorsToColorTable()
        Adds various colors to the _colorsTable

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor(int cardCounter)
        Obtains a color from one of the colors stored in _colorsTable, uses modulus operator to obtain the color in order.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Parameters:
        cardCounter - the current card count of whichever deck is being worked on.
        Returns:
        A color in order based on the int given.
